meanings.definition: Having the most cake-like texture or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The muffin was the cakiest treat at the bake sale.
meanings.sent2: The birthday cake was the cakiest dessert I've ever tasted.
meanings.sent3: The cakiest cupcake in the display tempted me with its sweet aroma.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as cakiest as a fluffy sponge cake.
meanings.sent5: The cakiest donut in the box was a delightful surprise.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'cakey', describing something as resembling cake.
meanings.sent1: The bakery's cakiest creation was a masterpiece of flavors.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork was the cakiest of all, with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The cakiest costume at the party made everyone crave dessert.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in the cakiest shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The cakiest clouds floated lazily in the summer sky.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'cakey', indicating something has more cake-like qualities than something else.
meanings.sent1: The new bakery in town serves the cakiest pastries in the city.
meanings.sent2: Her homemade cookies were cakiest than the ones from the store.
meanings.sent3: The cakiest slice of pie was gone before I could grab it.
meanings.sent4: The cakiest layer of the cake was the most delicious part.
meanings.sent5: The cakiest muffin in the basket was a delightful morning treat.
